description.narrative: 1. Increasing Bulgaria''s renewable energy output, and helping the country meet its renewable energy targets, including by diversifying its renewable energy mix; 2. Associated displacement of thermal power, resulting in avoidance of carbon emissions; 3. Demonstration effect, showing the viability of financing a large SPP on a limited recourse basis, and proving the ongoing viability of the Bulgarian RE sector, given recent changes to the RE Law.

The Project (Karadzhalovo SPP) involves the development, construction, operation and maintenance of a 60.4 MWp solar photovoltaic power plant at Karadzhalovo in the municipality of Parvomay, Plovdiv District, Bulgaria. All of the output generated by the Project will be sold to the national electricity company, Natsionalna Elektricheska Kompania EAD (NEK), a 100% subsidiary of the Ministry of Energy, Economy and Tourism under a 20-year PPA that will provide for a fixed Feed In Tariff (FiT), expected to be BGN 485.6/MWh (equivalent to 248.3/MWh).

name.narrative: The Project is located on a plot of land measuring about 100 hectares, close to the village of Karadzhalovo, in the municipality of Parvomay, Plovdiv District, which is about 160 km southeast of Sofia, the capital city of Bulgaria. The land was formerly owned by the Parvomay Municipality and used for agricultural purposes in the past. The agricultural status of the project site was re-zoned under the Municipalitys Master Plan and was converted to industrial use in 2006.
